==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|五|十|日}}

===Etymology===
Compound of [[五十|i]] "fifty" and [[日|ka]] "day".

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いか}}

# fifty days
#* c. 1028-1107: [[w:Eiga monogatari|Eiga monogatari]] (volume 1; page 32)
#*: はかなう御'''五十日'''なども過ぎもていきて、生まれ捨て三月といふに、七月廿三日に東宮にたゝせ給ぬ。
#* post 11th century: Sagoromo Monogatari (volume 2, page 182)
#*: まことに、かの若宮の御'''五十日'''にもなりぬれば、かゝる程も、「いかでかは」とて、内裏より、よろづに扱はせ給けり。

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ごとおび|hhira=ごとをび}}

# the days of the month that are multiples of 5 or 10: 5th, 10th, 15th, 20th, 25th, 30th. In Japan, financial transactions are most frequent on these days causing institutions and roads to be crowded.
